Specific Learning Outcomes:
By the end of the sub strand, the 
learner should be able to; 
a) 
describe 3-D objects in the 
environment, 
b) 
describe 2-D shapes in 3-D 
objects in the environment , 
c) 
use IT devices to learn more 
about 3-D objects and for  
leisure 
d) 
appreciate the use of 3-D 
objects in the environment.
Suggested Learning Experiences:
 
In  pairs, groups or as individuals 
identify and discuss cubes, cuboids, 
cylinders, spheres and pyramids as 3-D 
objects in the environment and share 
with other groups.  
 
Learners to watch a  video on 3-D 
objects.  
 
In   pairs or as individuals  describe  2-
D shapes found in 3-D objects and 
share with other groups. 
 
In  pairs or individuals  use IT devices 
to learn more about 3-D objects.
Key Inquiry Question(s):
Where are 3-D 
objects used in the 
environment?
